resources.string: Tap the button below to enable or disable heads-up notifications.

Are you using MIUI or a similar ROM? Before you can use this app, you'll probably need to give it some slack when it comes to security.
1. Go to System Settings > All > Apps > Downloaded > Heads-up notifications.
2. Toggle the switch that says 'Show popup windows' (second option).
3. At the bottom, go to 'Manage permissions'.
4. Set 'I trust this app' to on.
Like what you see? Check out my other apps as well:
Filter notifications based on their priority.\nRequires Android 4.1
Uncheck an app to mute it. You can also tap and hold on the X button in the heads-up to mute an app.
Check an app to keep heads-up from interfering while you\'re using it. Does not work on some Android 5+ devices.
Display the heads-up on the lockscreen.
If the app has been misbehaving lately, tap here to report the problem. You don\'t have to do anything if the app is behaving normally.\n\n

string-array.name: priorityLevel
string-array.item: Critical and urgent (missed calls, directions, emergency alerts)
Contextual and background info (weather, expired events, suggestions)

resources.string: Turn the screen on when you get a notification
Keep notifications on the lockscreen until you dismiss them
Use L\'s round icons instead of the squared icons from earlier releases
Don\'t turn the screen on if the phone is in a pocket or facedown on a table.
Don\'t display heads-up for notifications from the current app.\nThis does NOT work in Android 6.0+ due to a system restriction.
Display song metadata on track change.\nNote: not all music players are supported.
Both the notification listener and the accessibility service is enabled. Please disable one of them.
Select \'Heads-up notifications\' to toggle the service
Tap the icon to open the notification as a floating window. Experimental feature, works with OmniRom and XHaloFloatingWindow.
Hide the dismiss button from the notifications
Only display the first line of the notification.
Fine-tune the font size in the popups
Only display popups on the lockscreen.
Don\'t display message contents on the lockscreen
Enable this service to let Heads-up notifications display your notifications in an easy-to-read banner when they arrive.
After disabling this service, some features in Heads-up might not work properly.
No proximity sensor detected. Pocket detection will not work. Please DON\'T report this bug.
After turning the screen on, keep it on as long as the heads-up is visible.

Enabling this will allow Heads-up to turn off your screen.

Only turn this on if the screen doesn't turn off after displaying popups on the lockscreen.

If you continue, you will not be able to uninstall Heads-up until you turn this off.
You didn\'t read that, did you?
Device provisioning is not enabled. Stopping.
The service is enabled. Try sending yourself a message.\nIf it doesn\'t work, please reboot your device and try again.\nTap here if you need help
The service is running. Try sending yourself a message.\nTap here if you need help.
%s might be blocking Heads-up from accessing your notifications. Please disable it from the accessibility menu.
Remove the popup when you touch outside the heads-up

If you swipe the heads-up upwards, Heads-up will re-display it after the number of minutes you specify here. Set to zero to disable.\nWARNING: Experimental, unstable feature. Don\'t rely on it to work.
Warning: Google removed the ability to get running tasks in Android 6.0, so this will not work properly.
Remove notifications from the drawer when you swipe them away horizontally. You can still tap the X to dismiss from the drawer.\nRequires Android 4.3
Attempt to unlock the device when you open a notification. Disable if you get a blank desktop when opening a notification.
Give my other apps access to your notifications. This will reduce RAM usage if you use an app like Voiceify. Keep it off unless one of my apps ask you to enable it.
This will give %s access to your notifications. Are you sure this is what you want?
Show ongoing, non-clearable notifications displayed by background services like Downloads.\nNote: If some notifications refuse to go away, try disabling this.
If the normal unlock option doesn\'t work, try enabling this.\nWARNING: This will override all lockscreen security, and it can cause problems on some devices!

Thanks for downloading Heads-up.\n\nDuring setup, you\'ll see a few warnings from the Android system. They seem a bit scary, but don\'t worry; Heads-up does NOT collect, store or send your data anywhere.
Give Heads-up access to your notifications by tapping the button below, turning on Heads-up, and then pressing the back button on your device.
To allow Heads-up to view popups, tap the button below, set the swtich to on, and press the back button on your device.

If you see a heads-up notification at the top of your screen, you're ready to go!

Now, go to the settings page and tweak everything just the way you want it.

No heads-up notification appearing? Tap Help!
Thanks for trying Heads-up! If you like it, please leave a review on Play. If you can\'t get it to work, you can get help on the project\'s GitHub issue page.
Enabling this will make Heads-up consider the screen locked whenever it is turned off. Useful if you get notifications on the lock screen even if you have this setting turned off.
